result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph A Slough was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

supervisions.notes:
The Court sentences Joseph A Slough  to 8 years imprisonment, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 5 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3  years.

**8/22/19: Court orders 2 additional days credit.**

records.addlTxt:
[ma] Case called at 1:45pm 
Defendant Joseph A Slough appears via video conferencing from KMCI, in custody.  Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

On DOC's request for additional sentence credit:
--no objection from ADA Beck
--the Court grants the request, for a total of 537 days sentence credit  


recess: 1:47pm

records.addlTxt:
[MA]Case called at 8:34am
Defendant Joseph A Slough in court, in custody with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert.  Monica J. Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Counsel verify receipt and review of Revocation Packet

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
--Atty. Dahnert submits social media postings

Statement made by Mr. Slough

The Court sentences Joseph A Slough  to  8  years imprisonment, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of   5 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3  years.

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

The Court gives  535   days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo sexual evaluation, sexual deviance or other sex offender related evaluation, and comply with all treatment recommendations
--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--undergo AODA evaluation and follow through with treatment recommendations
--Follow through with any ongoing treatment recommendations
--No Contact with K.O.(dob 7/2/2000)
--Compliance with sex offender reporting requirements
--No Contact with any minor females except for immediate family members and the minor with the initials RAEF dob 10/9/13, unless otherwise authorized by Agent
--to provide DNA sample to designee upon demand
--to pay outstanding court costs/fees/surcharges

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Statute 941.291 body armor prohibition imposed; penalties recited

The Court informs Mr. Slough that violation of the no contact order could result in sererpate charges; recites maximum penaltes
recess: 8:59am

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Case called at 9:39am [mo]
Defendant Joseph A Slough in court with Attorney Steven W. Zaleski.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Zaleski indicates that a resolution has been reached. 

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Slough

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 5 years, with conditions:

--to serve 1 year in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on     1/6/16 at 7:00pm.
---Mr. Slough is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
--to undergo sexual evaluation, sexual deviance or other sex offender related evaluation per Agent
--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--Follow through with any ongoing treatment recommendations
--No Contact with K.O.(dob 7/2/2000)
--Compliance with sex offender reporting requirements
--No Contact with any minor females except for immediate family members and the minor with the initials RAEF dob 10/9/13, unless authorized by Agent
--to provide DNA sample to designee upon demand
--to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge

Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibition Warnings given
Days credit for time already served:  1  day
recess: 10:02am

Case called at 8:54 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Joseph A Slough in court with Attorney Steven W. Zaleski. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Slough waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.

Recess: 8:59 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Arraignment 9/29/15 at 2:30 pm - Send notices
Original Bond Document received from JESO on 8/26/15

[MK] case called at 1:18pm. 
Defendant Joseph A Slough appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek and Attorney Whitney Hagemann (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Mr. Slough verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correctr.
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by the Defense, however the State requests a Preliminary Hearing within time limits.

The Court requires a $7500  signature bond, with conditions:
--no contact K.O. date of birth 7/02/2000
--no physical contact with any juvenile except for incidental contact 
--not to communicate by electronic means or otherwise with any juvenile 
--processing [booking] at the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office 
recess 1:23pm. 

NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing on 9/11/15 at 8:30am. (twenty day time limit pends)
